intro: Centaurea cordonis, commonly known as the common centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually blue to violet in color, with a distinctive yellow center, and it blooms from late spring to early autumn. Centaurea cordonis is often found in grasslands, meadows, and along roadsides, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
